Prescription.UsagePlan: Administer 40mg orally once daily for 5-7 days for anti-inflammatory effect in the reactive airway disease exacerbation. Taper the dose gradually at the end of treatment to prevent adrenal insufficiency.
Prescription.Explanation: Methylprednisolone is a corticosteroid that helps in reducing airway inflammation and improving lung function in reactive airway disease exacerbations. It provides a more potent anti-inflammatory effect compared to inhaled corticosteroids and can be beneficial in managing acute exacerbations.

Prescription.UsagePlan: Take 875mg orally twice daily for 7-10 days to treat bacterial infection secondary to the viral URI. Complete the full course even if feeling better to prevent resistance.
Prescription.Explanation: Amoxicillin-Clavulanate is a broad-spectrum antibiotic effective against a wide range of bacteria that commonly cause secondary bacterial infections in patients with viral URI. It helps in preventing complications and promoting recovery.

Prescription.UsagePlan: Use 2 inhalations twice daily for maintenance therapy in reactive airway disease exacerbation. Rinse mouth after each use to prevent oral candidiasis.
Prescription.Explanation: Salmeterol-Fluticasone is a combination inhaler containing a long-acting beta agonist (LABA) and an inhaled corticosteroid. It provides both bronchodilation and anti-inflammatory effects, making it suitable for long-term control of symptoms in reactive airway disease exacerbations.

Prescription.UsagePlan: Start with 3.125mg orally twice daily and titrate up to target dose of 25mg twice daily for heart failure management in CHF exacerbation. Monitor heart rate and blood pressure closely during titration.
Prescription.Explanation: Carvedilol is a beta-blocker with additional alpha-blocking properties that can help improve heart function and reduce symptoms in patients with heart failure. It is beneficial in CHF exacerbations to optimize cardiac performance.

Prescription.UsagePlan: Take 10mg orally daily in the evening to reduce inflammation and improve symptoms in reactive airway disease exacerbations. It can be used as an alternative or add-on therapy.
Prescription.Explanation: Montelukast is a leukotriene receptor antagonist that helps in decreasing airway inflammation and constriction in reactive airway diseases like asthma. It can be useful in controlling symptoms and preventing exacerbations.
